articles.title: Bemused Waugh brushes off another Warne spray - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: Prompted by a tweet detailing Steve Waugh's run-out history, Shane Warne reactivates his old critique of his former teammate and friend.
articles.content:
Cricket fan and archivist Rob Moody compiled them all into one hour-long clip and posted it on his robelinda2 channel, which has been doing robust traffic in the coronavirus hiatus. "OMG, he was just awful at calling," Moody remarked. "Just, awful."

articles.title: Disgraced cyclist Lance Armstrong fears drug use led to testicular cancer, 21, 30 for 30 documentary - NEWS.com.au
articles.description: Disgraced cyclist Lance Armstrong fears drug use led to testicular cancer
articles.content: Disgraced cyclist Lance Armstrong claims he first took performance-enhancing drugs aged 21 and wonders if it may have contributed to his testicular cancer. But the discredited US cyclist insists he sleeps well at night despite being exposed as a serial doper … [+4793 chars]

articles.author: Nick Mulvenney
articles.title: 'Massive gamble' to coach in A-League paid off, says Robbie Fowler - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: The Liverpool legend led Brisbane Roar, who finished second last the previous season, to fourth place in the A-League before the season was suspended.
articles.content:
Robbie Fowler believes his decision to move to Australia was a gamble that paid off and that his Brisbane Roar side would have been contenders for the A-League title until the coronavirus outbreak intervened.
The former England and Liverpool striker only had… [+880 chars]

articles.title: ‘I won’t hold my breath’: Aussie backs $37m star in spicy tennis pay dispute - Fox Sports
articles.description: John Millman has defended Dominic Thiem after the world No. 3 refused to help fund lower-ranked tennis players struggling during the coronavirus shutdown.
articles.content:
Respected Australian veteran Millman says it should not be up to top-ranked players to prop up the tour, instead pointing the finger at governing bodies ATP, WTA and ITF for not addressing pay disparity concerns.
Australian Open finalist Thiem who has more t… [+2118 chars]

articles.content:
